title: Rear Sprocket Carrier Bearings - Assembly

body.body: When using a press, always wear overalls, eye, face and hand protection. Objects such as bearings frequently break-up under load and the debris caused during break-up may cause damage and injury to unprotected parts of the body.
Never wear loose clothing, which could become trapped in the press and cause crushing injury to the hand, arms or other parts of the anatomy.
Position the bearing, marked side facing outwards, to the drive flange.
Using a suitable press, fully insert the bearing into the sprocket carrier, ensuring both the inner and outer races are pressed.
Install a new seal, marked side facing outwards, to the sprocket carrier.
Lubricate the seal’s knife-edge with grease to NLGI 2 specification.
Install the cush drive rubbers to the wheel hub.
Fit the spacer to the wheel hub as noted for removal.
Refit the sprocket carrier to the wheel.
